name: winter pond, ice
description:
In the middle of the winter the snow has fallen and been walked in by small animals, the ice on the pond has frozen, broken and re-frozen, and trees are bare, allowing you to see into the woods in ways you can't when the leaves are out. I wanted to capture that moment in fabric. Using cotton and silk, torn and cut, I composed the scene. Careful stitching adds detail and definition. 

This 8x10" reproduction of an original artwork is printed on archival paper and mounted on white foam core, ready for framing.

name: summer pond, lily pads
description:
In the drowsy heat of summer you can hear the insects call, but the frogs stay silent until night fall, hiding under the lily pads. I wanted to capture that moment in fabric. Using ripped and cut cottons and silk, I composed the basic image. Careful stitching adds detail and definition. 

This is a reproduction of an original artwork. Printed on archival paper, and mounted on white foam core, the 8x10" picture is ready to frame.

name: fall pond, leaves
description:
On a brilliant, sunny, blue sky day at the height of fall color, you can smell the crisp leaves in the air. I wanted to capture that moment in fabric. Using ripped and cut quilting cottons and silk, I composed the basic image, then added detail with thread and stitching. 

This reproduction of an original stitched artwork, on archival paper mounted on white foam core, is 8x10", ready for framing.

name: veils of mist
description:
Remember the way the mist obscures the trees across the pond, and the cattails are reflected in the water? I wanted to capture that quiet moment in fabric. using cut and torn cottons and silks, I composed the basic picture. I added detail using thread and stitching. 

This is a high quality reproduction of the original stitched artwork, on archival paper, mounted on white foam core. 

8x10"
